Re ''Inside the Kill Zone'' (editorial, ''Insecure Nation'' series, May 22): As you point out, the nation's chemical plants are vulnerable to attack, with potentially devastating consequences to surrounding populations.
Two of the solutions you proposed -- the use of safer chemicals and reduced quantities of dangerous chemicals -- are part of an engineering design approach known as inherent safety.

Industry has been slow to adopt this approach, but must now be persuaded or required to do so. In redesigning its processes for inherent safety, the chemical industry could also respond to other neglected challenges.

Sustainability, in regard to climate change and other issues, will involve shifts in demand and the need to deploy new processes and technology. Adopting such new processes could also prepare the industry for a peak in world oil production, which many observers predict will occur within a decade or two.
Gordon Thompson Exec. Dir., Institute for Resource and Security Studies Cambridge, Mass., May 23, 2005
